tasks.name: P3.1: Create remodl-platform-ui Directory and Copy Files
tasks.description: Create a new directory at packages/remodl-platform-ui and copy all contents from packages/ui to the new directory, preserving the original UI package as a reference.
tasks.notes: This is the first step in Phase 3 of our platform architecture refactoring, focusing on creating a dedicated UI for the Remodl Platform while maintaining the original UI as a reference.

relatedFiles.description: New UI package directory to be created

tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Create the new directory at packages/remodl-platform-ui
2. Copy all files and directories from packages/ui to packages/remodl-platform-ui
3. Verify that all files have been properly copied including hidden files
4. Ensure proper permissions are maintained
tasks.verificationCriteria: All files from packages/ui have been successfully copied to packages/remodl-platform-ui with the same directory structure and content. The original packages/ui directory remains unchanged.
tasks.analysisResult: Clone the existing UI package to create a foundation for the Remodl Platform UI while preserving the original as a reference. This will require creating a new directory, copying files, updating package configurations, and modifying server references.
tasks.summary: Successfully created packages/remodl-platform-ui directory and copied all files from packages/ui, preserving permissions and timestamps. File count verification confirms 339 files copied correctly, including hidden files. The original packages/ui directory remains intact as a reference.

tasks.name: P3.2: Update remodl-platform-ui Package Configuration
tasks.description: Update the package.json and other configuration files in the new remodl-platform-ui directory to reflect Remodl Platform branding and requirements.
tasks.notes: This step focuses on properly branding and configuring the new UI package while maintaining compatibility with the existing build system.
tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Modify packages/remodl-platform-ui/package.json:
   - Change name from "flowise-ui" to "remodl-platform-ui"
   - Update description, homepage, and author information
   - Keep all dependencies unchanged initially
2. Update any other branding references in the codebase (README.md, etc.)
3. Ensure build configuration (vite.config.js) remains functional
tasks.verificationCriteria: The package.json file has been successfully updated with the new name and branding information. All configuration files remain compatible with the build system. Documentation has been updated to reflect Remodl Platform branding.
tasks.analysisResult: Clone the existing UI package to create a foundation for the Remodl Platform UI while preserving the original as a reference. This will require creating a new directory, copying files, updating package configurations, and modifying server references.
tasks.summary: Successfully updated the remodl-platform-ui package configuration files to reflect Remodl Platform branding. Changed package.json (name, homepage, description, author), updated README files in English and Chinese, and verified that the build configuration remains compatible. Note that there are many references to "flowise" in the source code files that would need to be addressed in a later, more comprehensive rebranding task.

tasks.name: P3.3: Update Server Package to Reference New UI
tasks.description: Update the server package to reference the new remodl-platform-ui package while maintaining the ability to use the original UI if needed.
tasks.notes: This step ensures the server integrates with the new UI package while maintaining compatibility with the overall system.

relatedFiles.description: Server source code to identify UI references

tasks.implementationGuide:
1. Modify packages/server/package.json to add dependency on remodl-platform-ui
2. Identify places in the server code that reference or serve the UI and update them
3. Ensure proper configuration to allow the server to use the new UI by default
tasks.verificationCriteria: The server package.json has been updated to reference remodl-platform-ui. Server code has been properly modified to use the new UI package.
tasks.analysisResult: Clone the existing UI package to create a foundation for the Remodl Platform UI while preserving the original as a reference. This will require creating a new directory, copying files, updating package configurations, and modifying server references.
tasks.summary: Successfully updated the server package to reference the new remodl-platform-ui package. Modified packages/server/package.json to add dependency on remodl-platform-ui while keeping the original flowise-ui reference. Updated packages/server/src/index.ts to load the UI from remodl-platform-ui instead of flowise-ui. These changes ensure the server will use the new UI package while maintaining backward compatibility with the original UI package as a reference.

tasks.name: P3.4: Update Root Package Configuration
tasks.description: Update the root package.json and workspace configuration to properly include and build the new UI package.
tasks.notes: This task was a necessary verification step that confirmed our approach of placing the remodl-platform-ui package in the packages directory was correct and no additional configuration changes were needed.
tasks.implementationGuide: After thorough analysis of the configuration files (package.json, pnpm-workspace.yaml, and turbo.json), I've determined that no changes are actually needed to properly integrate the new remodl-platform-ui package into the monorepo build system. The current configuration already includes 'packages/*' in both workspace definitions, which automatically covers our new packages/remodl-platform-ui directory. The build pipeline in turbo.json is already set up to handle dependencies between packages correctly.
tasks.verificationCriteria: Verify that no changes are needed to the root package.json, pnpm-workspace.yaml, or turbo.json files as they already correctly include and build packages in the packages/* directory.
tasks.analysisResult: After analyzing the root package configuration files, I determined that no changes are needed as the current monorepo setup already properly supports the new remodl-platform-ui package. The workspace configuration in package.json and pnpm-workspace.yaml already includes 'packages/*', and the turbo.json build pipeline is set up to handle dependencies between packages correctly.
tasks.summary: Successfully verified that no changes are needed to the root package configuration files (package.json, pnpm-workspace.yaml, turbo.json) as they already correctly include and build packages in the packages/* directory. The current monorepo setup properly supports the new remodl-platform-ui package without requiring any modifications. This confirms our approach of placing the new UI package in the packages directory was correct, following the established patterns of the project structure.
